metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2977 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel implementation of proxied virtualized TPM devices. On a system where virtualized TPM devices are configured (this is not the default) a local attacker can create a use-after-free and create a situation where it may be possible to escalate privileges on the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2977` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-6.2.0-36-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-36-generic-64k - 5.19.0-15.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1015-aws - 5.19.0-1005.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> unclear if fb5abce6b2bb ("tpm: use try_get_ops() in tpm-space.c") is related or a separate issue.
